decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive early-game plays to pressure the opponent and control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Vein Ripper. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides additional support for the aggro playstyle, while cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse offer a powerful late-game threat. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instant and sorcery spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated attacks. It includes cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand to dig for those cards, while also running disruptive spells like Spell Pierce to protect the game plan. The deck also utilizes cards like Ledger Shredder and Ashiok, Dream Render to disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle centered around recurring Arclight Phoenix.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively cast spells and take advantage of graveyard recursion to quickly bring back Arclight Phoenixes. The deck utilizes a combination of card draw, burn spells, and cheap spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability and put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Ledger Shredder and Treasure Cruise helps with maintaining card advantage and finding key pieces to close out the game. The deck aims to be fast and relentless, overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggression and resilience.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using green devotion cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Elvish Mystic, allowing for powerful plays with high-cost creatures like Cavalier of Thorns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and powerful spells, using cards like Storm the Festival and Ulvenwald Oddity to maintain board presence and pressure. The inclusion of cards like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Oath of Nissa helps to further support the deck's theme of green devotion and aggro gameplay.
